name: Peter Drucker
background: Father of modern management. Coined 'knowledge worker'. Consulted for GE, IBM, Intel. Emphasized management as a liberal art combining ethics, economics, psychology, and philosophy.

principles.name: Customer Focus
principles.description: The purpose of a business is to create and serve a customer; profit is not the goal but a validation of value creation.
principles.falsification: When customer focus leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Decentralization
principles.description: Large organizations work best when decentralized, with autonomous units focused on results rather than control.
principles.falsification: When decentralization leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Foresight and Continuous Improvement
principles.description: Anticipate change, invest in lifelong learning, and measure effectiveness by results outside the organization.
principles.falsification: When foresight and continuous improvement leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things
principles.description: Efficiency and effectiveness are different. Optimize for outcomes, not activity. The most efficient pursuit of the wrong goal is still failure.
principles.falsification: When execution speed is the constraint and the goal is clearly correct
